textBeforeTable: Freshman Year Following is one suggested four-year degree plan. Students are encouraged to see their advisor each semester for help with program decisions and enrollment. Students are responsible for meeting all course prerequisites. BS in Engineering Technology Major in Construction Engineering Technology g. Courses taken to satisfy the technical options in each concentration must be approved by the academic advisor. f. A 2.5 GPA is required for engineering technology courses in the area of concentration. e. ENGL 2700 is required instead of ENGL 1320 (satisfies College of Engineering Core requirement). d. PHYS 1710/1730 and 2220/2240 and CHEM 1410/1430 (may be used to satisfy the Natural Sciences requirement of the University Core Curriculum). c. CSCE 4010, Engineering Ethics. b. ENGR 2060 (may be used to satisfy the Understanding the Human Community requirement of the University Core and College of Engineering Core). a. ENGR 1030 (may be used to satisfy the Social and Behavioral Sciences requirement of the University Core Curriculum). 6. Other Requirements: 5. Electives: See four-year plan. 4. Minor: Optional. 3. Other Course Requirements: MATH 1710 and 1720. Students registering for fall or spring term/semester must register for mathematics until the requirement has been satisfied, unless approved by the department chair. A minimum of 12 semester hours of mathematics is required.
